question: Which is the main calcium binding protein of the sarcoplasmic reticulum?
ideal_answer: Calsequestrin is the major calcium-binding protein of cardiac and skeletal muscles whose function is to sequester Ca(2+ )in the lumen of the sarcoplasmic reticulum (SR).
